name: Parth H. Pathak
content: Parth Pathak Parth Pathak Home Research Publications Group Teaching I am an associate professor in the Computer Science Department in the School of Computing at George Mason University. Before joining Mason, I was a postdoc at University of California, Davis where I worked with Dr. Prasant Mohapatra. I received my Ph.D. in Computer Science from North Carolina State University in 2012 where I worked with Dr. Rudra Dutta. I am a recipient of the NSF CAREER award (2021), CCI Fellowship (2023), IDIA P3 fellowship (2023) and Excellence in Postdoctoral Research award at UC Davis (2015). Email: phpathak@gmu.edu CV Google Scholar Research Interests My research interest are broadly in the areas of wireless networking and mobile computing. I am currently interested in High-speed millimeter-wave wireless networks for supporting applications such as AR/VR/MR, Application of machine learning in wireless networking and sensing, Low-power, high-speed Internet-of-Things (IoT) including backscatter systems, Wireless sensing and imaging for autonomous robotic systems including UGVs and drones News May '25 Our SenSys paper received a best paper nomination (7 out of 45 accepted and 245 submitted papers) April '25 Our MobiSys paper presents a spoofing resilient and backscatter communication integrated mmWave sensing Feb. '25 New SenSys paper on high accuracy UWB sensing for car occupancy determination Dec. '24 Yoon Chae defended his Ph.D. thesis and will join as assistant professor in CS@UTA. Arpil '24 Our NSDI paper presents a high-speed mmWave commodity WiFi backscatter system. August '23 New Mobicom paper proposes the use of street view images for efficient vehicular mmWave links. More...
